law.catch_line: The Corporation may authorize the issuance of revenue bonds by resolution....

text.section: The Corporation may authorize the issuance of revenue bonds by resolution.

The Corporation may issue the bonds:
to finance all or part of the costs of a project; and
for any other lawful purpose of the Corporation authorized in this subtitle.
The Corporation may issue the bonds at one time or from time to time.
An officer's signature or facsimile signature on a bond remains valid even if the officer leaves office before the bond is delivered.

section.section: The bonds are negotiable instruments under the laws of the State.
The Corporation may sell the bonds by competitive or negotiated sale in a manner and for a price that the Corporation determines.
The bonds are exempt from §§ 8-206 and 8-208 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

text.section: Bond proceeds may be placed in escrow pending application of the proceeds to the purposes for which the bonds are issued.
